...Damien Sayre Chazelle ( ; born January 19, 1985) is an American director and screenwriter.  After making his directorial debut with the musical Guy and Madeline on a Park Bench (2009), his breakthrough came when he wrote and directed his second feature film, Whiplash (2014), which was based on his 2013 short film of the same name.  The film premiered at Sundance Film Festival and went on to receive five Academy Award  nominations, including Best Picture and Best Adapted Screenplay...

...The film premiered at Sundance Film Festival and went on to receive five Academy Award  nominations, including Best Picture  and Best Adapted Screenplay  . His 2016 film La La Land  received critical and commercial acclaim, winning all 7 of its Golden Globe nominations, including Best Picture - Musical or Comedy  , Best Director and Best Original Screenplay .  It also received a record-tying 14 Academy Award  nominations, winning six including Best Director  , with Chazelle becoming the youngest person in history to win the category at age 32....

... It began a limited release in the United States on December 9, 2016, with a wider release on December 16, 2016.  It has received rave reviews from critics.
